articles.author: John Hayward
articles.title: Chinese Man Covers Himself with Firecrackers, Gasoline After Coronavirus Cancels His Birthday Party
articles.description: A 59-year-old man in Chongqing, China is facing criminal charges for threatening to kill himself with firecrackers and gasoline because his birthday party was canceled by officials worried about the coronavirus epidemic.
articles.content:
A 59-year-old man in Chongqing, China, is facing criminal charges for threatening to kill himself with firecrackers and gasoline because his birthday party was canceled by officials worried about the coronavirus epidemic.

articles.title: China Demands Resumption of Air Travel as Coronavirus Epidemic Rages
articles.description: Chinese state media on Wednesday demanded foreign carriers resume air travel even though the coronavirus epidemic is still raging.
articles.content:
Chinese state media on Wednesday demanded foreign carriers resume air travel even though the coronavirus epidemic is still raging.

articles.author: Penny Starr
articles.title: China: Guangzhou Metropolis Bans Restaurant Dining over Coronavirus
articles.description: China's southern port city of Guangzhou banned dining in restaurants, local media reported Wednesday, as a measure to prevent the novel coronavirus epidemic in the country from becoming worse.
articles.content:
China’s southern port city of Guangzhou banned dining in restaurants, local media reported Wednesday, as a measure to prevent the novel coronavirus epidemic in the country from becoming worse.

articles.author: John Carney
articles.title: Economists Think China’s Growth Will Suffer A Steep Coronavirus Drop
articles.description: The impact of the coronavirus on China's economy is likely to be large. Economists expect only a small drag on the U.S. economy. | Economy
articles.content:
Growth in China’s economy is likely to be severely held back by the coronavirus, HSBC said Thursday.
The bank lowered its estimate for the first quarter growth from an annualized rate of 5.8 percent to 4.1 percent. The bank’s estimate for full year growth wa… [+911 chars]

articles.title: Xi Jinping Appoints Top Loyalist to Head Communist Party in Coronavirus Province
articles.description: The Communist Party of China appointed Ying Yong, the mayor of Shanghai, the new head of the Party in Hubei province on Thursday, as well as replacing the Party leader in Hubei's capital, Wuhan, the epicenter of the ongoing coronavirus outbreak.
